How do I use the `settxfee` command to set the transaction fee to a specific amount?

You can use the `settxfee` command to set the transaction fee to a specific amount by providing the amount as an argument. For example, to set the transaction fee to 0.00001 VRSC/kB, you would use the following command:

```
verus settxfee 0.00001
```

Alternatively, you can use the RPC API to set the transaction fee using a tool like `curl`. Here's an example:

```bash
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "settxfee", "params": [0.00001] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

settxfee amount Set the transaction fee per kB. Arguments: 1. amount     (numeric, required) The transaction fee in VRSC/kB rounded to the nearest 0.00000001 Result true|false    (boolean) Returns true if successful Examples: > verus settxfee 0.00001 > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "settxfee", "params": [0.00001] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
